episodes.title: CULT LEADER TOBI ADEGBOYEGA: Set to be deported  from the UK over being illegal and  £1.87m fraud
episodes.description:
The flashy, self-styled pastor and cult leader Tobi Adegboyega is finally facing deportation after years of scamming vulnerable people under the guise of faith. Known for his extravagant lifestyle, designer suits, and luxury cars, Tobi’s SPAC Nation church was a front for manipulation and financial exploitation, targeting young people desperate for hope.

This video uncovers the shocking details of Tobi’s schemes, the heartbreaking stories of his victims, and the long-overdue justice being served. How did a man with so many allegations against him operate unchecked for so long? And why are authorities only acting now?

As an atheist, I’m here to break down how figures like Tobi use religion as a tool for personal gain, leaving devastation in their wake. Join me as I expose the truth behind Tobi the cult leader and discuss why his deportation is just the beginning of holding exploitative preachers accountable.

Justice is finally catching up with him—let’s talk about it!
#PastorTobi #SPACNation #ReligiousScams #CultLeaderExposed #TobiAdegboyega #JusticeForVictims #ScamExposed #ReligionAndExploitation #Deportation #AccountabilityNow #ExposingScammers #CultWatch #StopReligiousAbuse #AtheistPerspective #CallOutTheScam #justicematters

episodes.title: KATHRYN KRICK: Dangerous Exorcisms on Children
episodes.description:
Join us as we dive into the disturbing practices of Kathryn Krick, the lead pastor of Five-Fold Church in Los Angeles, who has built a platform by claiming to cast out demons—even from children. Kathryn Krick’s approach to "deliverance" raises serious ethical concerns, with troubling methods that involve labeling young kids as demon-possessed and using intense rituals to "lay hands" on them. This livestream will challenge her barbaric practices, questioning how this impacts children’s mental and emotional well-being. As atheists, we’re deeply concerned about these practices under the guise of faith. It’s time to call out Kathryn Krick and advocate for the safety and protection of these vulnerable children.

As an atheist, I don't believe in spirits, but the practice raises serious ethical questions. Why avoid healthy conversations and conflict resolution? episodes.title: The Henry Family: How the Parents can negatively impact on the children

#thehenryfamily #beliefs #god 
In this livestream, we explore the story of the Henry family, a family of 2 parents and 8 kids who decided to share their lives and family business on YouTube. The mother claims that God instructed her to homeschool their children, sparking questions about the impact of parental beliefs on children's upbringing. As an atheist, I delve into the potential consequences of raising kids under such convictions, asking whether this is truly what the children need. Is it possible that such beliefs could be harmful? episodes.title: Is Jerry Eze a Cult Leader?
Debunking Jerry Eze’s 'Miracle' at London Conference: The Truth Behind the Cerebral Palsy Claim
episodes.description:
Welcome to today's livestream where we critically examine the recent claims made by Jerry Eze at his London conference. In an event that has captured significant attention, Eze has asserted that he healed a child with cerebral palsy, allowing her to walk. However, a closer look at this so-called 'miracle' reveals a disheartening and, frankly, disgusting reality. While the child may have been able to walk, she has not been cured of cerebral palsy.

As an atheist committed to truth and rationality, we find it essential to challenge these narratives that exploit vulnerable individuals and perpetuate false hope. We'll dissect the claims, scrutinise the evidence, and discuss the ethical implications of such assertions. Join us as we seek to uncover the truth behind Jerry Eze’s controversial statement and advocate for genuine, science-based understanding and support for those living with cerebral palsy.

episodes.title: Exposing Abel Damina's Hypocrisy: The Grift of African Preachers
episodes.description:
Join me for a revealing live stream as I delve into the controversial shift of Abel Damina. A African Preacher claiming to have the true gospel of Jesus and Christianity a religion brought to Africa by colonialism and missionaries. Once a staunch advocate for the collection of tithes, Damina has now reversed his stance, presenting himself as a champion of transparency and integrity. But is this change genuine, or is it just another facade to continue exploiting followers for profit?
I will:
Unpack Damina's contradictory sermons on tithing.
Examine what he teaches under the guise of spirituality. Discuss the broader issue of religious exploitation and the role of pastors in modern-day scams. Don't miss this eye-opening discussion about the true motives behind Abel Damina's actions. Tune in, share your thoughts, and help uncover the truth about religious hypocrisy and financial manipulation and ultimately the scam of religion.

episodes.title: Africa’s Deadliest Christian Cult- over 400 dead including kids. @Paul Mackenzie
episodes.description:
Join me for this one, exposing the evil in the religion of Christianity. This is Kenya’s doomsday cult where victims have crossed the 400 mark as detectives exhumed 12 more bodies on believed to be followers of a pastor who ordered them to fast to death in order to meet Jesus. Apparently the number of those who died has risen to 403, with 95 people rescued.
Paul Mackenzie has been charged with murder after the bodies were found buried in shallow graves in the remote forest of Shakahola in the east of the country.
Survivors and victims' families have said Paul Mackenzie urged followers to fast in order to "go see Jesus".
He and 29 others pleaded not guilty in a court in the coastal town of Malindi.
Mackenzie has already been charged with committing acts of terror, child cruelty and torture, which he denied.
